Loud music, 3 pitbull's running around no leashes, people screaming.  Cops get called every night no one shows up.  Breeding ground for pitbulls and dancing all night!
Loud noise coming from Marina across the street. Running generators and lights all night.
People out past curfew. Very loud and possibly damaging parked cars.

Tons of people out congregating by the monument and many other public places in Charlestown. A lot of them bring picnic blankets and beer and wine. Because of these assholes, we are all going to be locked down for longer. The city needs to put up signs, have a visible presence, or just close off these places.
D'tails is doing grooming services for dogs currently. Grooming is not an essential service according to the Governor's essential businesses order. Shit it down
Cathedral high school has left their basketball net intact and an awful lot of people were playing very close basketball today (not social distancing)
address: Intersection Of Washington St & Waltham St, Roxbury

status_notes: Case Resolved. Thank you for contacting Boston 311! Any noise related to car alarms, loud parties, or sound amplification devices can be reported to the Boston Police by dialing and calling 9-1-1.

status_notes: Case Resolved. Thank you for contacting Boston 311! Any noise related to car alarms, loud parties, or sound amplification devices can be reported by calling 9-1-1. Or contact the Boston Police department party line at 617-343-5500.
description: Group of people partying and no social distance playing loud music you guys should come and break it up

status_notes: Case Resolved. Thank you for contacting Boston 311! More information is needed in order to process this request. Keep in mind, any noise related to car alarms, loud parties, or sound amplification devices can be reported to Boston Police by dialing 9-1-1. Any noise related to construction sites, industrial sites, or ventilation systems can be reported to 311.
description: Noise complaint.

status_notes: Case Resolved. Thank you for contacting Boston 311! Any noise related to car alarms, loud parties, or sound amplification devices can be reported to 9-1-1 or the BPD Party line at 617-343-5500.
description: Loud music and several members outside. Green house with gravel driveway, I'm unsure if the address of the house is correct.

status_notes: Case Resolved. Thank you for contacting Boston 311. To report public drinking, call and dial 9-1-1. A trained operator will ask for necessary information and can dispatch a police unit.
description: Group of people congregating on porch.  Loud. Drunk

Numerous young people on dirt bikes and four wheelers speeding up Beacon Street and around the Common - Speeding, wheelies, through crosswalks and red lights - this happens on a nightly basis - I have called 911 multiple times - nothing gets done - is BPD that unaware? Who is nothing done about this serious safety issue??????

status_notes: Case Resolved. Installed new SLCB and panel board. YR TM.
description: Fallen cable box in bike lane

Can someone please explain why the police in this city allow the same group of people on dirt bikes and four wheelers to drive around the city night after night?  They speed down Tremont and circle the Common over and over and never get pulled over.  This is an accident waiting to happen.  I know others have reported this as I have also seen it on Reddit.
Kids congregating in street and sidewalk skateboarding, not social distancing etc.
Unsecure construction site. Missing windows and compromised foundation. Problem waiting to happen.

status_notes: Case Resolved. Thank you for contacting Boston 311! Any noise related to car alarms, loud music, or sound amplification devices can be reported to the Boston Police department. Dial and call 9-1-1 to speak with an operator.
description: Reported this many times last year-sidewalk car stereo installation near 230 Magnolia Street. Seats out of cars on sidewalk, Music so loud it shakes my house, sets off car alarms etc.

status_notes: Case Resolved. Thank you for contacting 311! Both of these matters can be reported to the police by dialing and calling 9-1-1. Drag racing is considered to be a crime. Any noise related to loud music, car alarms, or sound amplification noises can be reported to 9-1-1 as well.
description: Constant drag racing post curfew and loud music

status_notes: Case Resolved. Thank you for contacting 311! Trespassing is illegal and can be reported to the police. Dial and call 9-1-1 when and if this is still taking place. A trained operator will ask for necessary information.
description: Man rummaging around through dumpsters behind Clearway St apartments. With recent dumpster fires in Back Bay, this is a liability.

@ Lydia Edwards- many, many years ago, the city took away 2-3 parking spots at this corner (Commercial St & Hull Street) for Hansom Cad idling (they were housed overnight in the North End/Kinney garage). The horses & cans are long gone. Can we get our parking spots back please? Thanks!
address: Intersection Of Hull St & Commercial St, Boston

description: The amount of people congregating, picnicking and absolutely not social distancing or wearing masks at the Bunker Hill Monument today, was terrifying. As a healthcare worker, I consider this disrespectful and ignorant. I support ticketing and/or closing parks all together if adults can't follow the city's simple rules.
